intro: Borreria chartensis, commonly known as Mexican redroot, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in scrubland and woodland habitats. Borreria chartensis is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
